content: to first stitch of this round half_double_crochet to end 2hdc in last st count 30 turn round 9 ws repeat row 7 32 round 10 rs repeat row 8 33 round 11 ws repeat row 7 35 round 12 rs repeat row 8 36 round 13 ws repeat row 7 38 round 14 rs repeat row 8 39 round 15 ws repeat row 7 41 round 16 rs repeat row 8 42 test try it out in the cup again if it is tall enough move on to the button loop if too short add two more rounds round 17 ws repeat row 7 44 round 18 rs repeat row 8 45 finishing button loop chain 6 or as many needed to fit around your button slip stitch into last stitch if not adding the border securely tie off here border optional instead of ending at the loop turn the sleeve sideways and add a row of single_crochet down the edge in the lavender example i made two stitches per row depending on your yarn and gauge a different ratio might work better button try out the sleeve on a cup wrap the right side with the button loop over the left use a stitch marker to mark where the button should be approximately 10cm 4 in from the left corner the sleeve should be snug around the cup like a sock sew the button on snap optional if the left/inner corner is sticking out or falling down you can sew in a hidden snap stitch if you re getting a gap at the base where it splits you can just sew a little bit shut look at the angle it should be when buttoned pin or clip it in place turn it inside out and try not to sew all the way through to the front side final step weave in all the ends you re finished well done i hope you enjoyed the pattern it brings me so much joy to share my ideas and even more when i see that someone has made one if you have any questions or comments please send a message through ravelry or email me at jenniferdcknsn@gmail com
